text: Juan Carlos Alvarado (born December 28, 1964) is a famous Christian pop singer and pastor known for his songs such as Jehová es mi guerrero, Cristo no está muerto and No basta. He is located in the same praise movement of the 80's, along with Marcos Witt, Marco Barrientos, Jaime Murrell and others. == Career == In 1987, Alvarado recorded his first album, Digno De Alabar with the group Palabra En Acción. In 1993, Alvarado recorded his first solo album entitled Aviva El Fuego. A year later, Alvarado recorded "Lion Of Juda" in Spanish under Word Records, an American label. After the production of Aviva El Fuego, Hosanna! Music and CanZion Productions both worked with Alvarado to produce Glorifícate and Tu Palabra consecutively in 1993. In 1995, Alvarado released Hoy Más Que Ayer. More recent releases include Fuego En Vivo and Tu Palabra Cantaré. ==Discography== === With Palabra En Acción === * Digno De Alabar (1987) * Jehová Es Mi Guerrero (1988) * Glorificad A Jehová (1989) * Santo Es El Señor (1990) * Más Que Vencedor (1991) === Solo === * Aviva El Fuego (1993) * Tu Palabra (1993) * Glorifícate (1993) * León De Judá (1994) * Hoy Más Que Ayer (1995) * Colección 1 (1998) * Nunca Digas Nunca (1999) * Lo Mejor De Juan Carlos Alvarado En Palabra En Acción (2000) * Vivo Para Cristo (2001) * Fiesta (2004) * Lo Mejor De Juan Carlos Alvarado En Palabra En Acción ll (2006) * Fuego (2006) * Tu Palabra Cantaré (2008) * Momentos De Adoración (2010) * Fuego 2 (TBA) Category:Guatemalan people Category:Christian music singers Category:1964 births Category:Living people
title: Juan Carlos Alvarado
